intro: Alysicarpus trifoliatus, commonly known as the three-leaved burr vine, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It is characterized by its trifoliate leaves, which consist of three leaflets arranged symmetrically. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers followed by distinctive, spiny fruits that contain seeds. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often found in disturbed soils or along roadsides. Due to its unique appearance and adaptability, it is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental plant.
